intro: Hieracium rhacoscelum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster, producing small seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium rhacoscelum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
